meanings.definition: Most firmly or closely fixed in place or position.
meanings.sent1: The rope was pulled tightest to secure the boat to the dock.
meanings.sent2: She tied the knot tightest to ensure it wouldn't come undone.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel held the nut tightest in its paws, refusing to share.
meanings.sent4: His grip on the steering wheel was the tightest during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The lid was closed tightest to keep the contents fresh.

meanings.sent1: The tightest suitcase was packed efficiently for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The files were arranged tightest on the shelf for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces fit together tightest, forming a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was the tightest, with every minute planned out.
meanings.sent5: The team worked tightest to finish the project ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: Most strict or stringent in control or discipline.
meanings.sent1: The coach had the tightest rules for the team to follow.
meanings.sent2: The school had the tightest dress code in the district.
meanings.sent3: The librarian kept the quietest library, enforcing the tightest silence.
meanings.sent4: The security at the event was the tightest, ensuring no unauthorized entry.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's grading was the tightest, leaving no room for errors.
